alert.note: Alert for Kofa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 12:09PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central La Paz and north central Yuma Counties through 1245 PM MST... At 1209 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kofa Wildlife Refuge, or 41 miles southeast of Parker, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kofa Wildlife Refuge and Brenda. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 25 and 42. US Highway 60 between mile markers 31 and 44. AZ Route 72 between mile markers 34 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
